item.title: on a remarkably unremarkable change
item.description: Dusting off my camera has been a peculiar experience. Part of it is has been like riding a bike - all the dials and clicks still feel about right. A little awkward, but right. Part of it feels completely different, as if I am engaging in a different craft than that of a past life, one where I would greedily capture moments without a second care. Learning to film my current realities has made me painfully cognizant of the cycle my life (and perhaps most of the world) has drifted into.
